snippet: The investigation, based on thousands of photos of torture victims smuggled out of Syria by a police photographer, is hailed as an important, if symbolic, step.
abstract: France opens criminal investigation into torture in Syria under al-Assad regime, based on tens of thousands of photographs of victims taken by Syrian defector; inquiry, world's first, will be largely symbolic until French victim is found or Syrian official is arrested; move is seen as implicit challenge to Russia's support of Assad.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The investigation, based on thousands of photos of torture victims smuggled out of Syria by a police photographer, is hailed as an important, if symbolic, step.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; France: Criminal Investigation Opened Into Suspicion of Torture by Syria
headline.main: France Opens Criminal Investigation of Torture in Syria Under Assad
